jmf.module

Class AbstractModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • jmf.module.AbstractModule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JavaModule, TestModule

    public abstract class AbstractModule
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class of a JMF module. Defines methods to override and offers access to the underlying JMF instance. Every module must have an ID (type+instance), a version, a name and optionally dependencies. The base class offers a logger and JMF access via IFrameworkAccess. Created on 7/25/15. Modified on 08/06/15
    Author:
    Jonas Grunert, Tobias Korb, Jan Strau√ü

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractModule

        public AbstractModule(ModuleUniqueId uniqueId,
                      short version,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.util.Collection<ModuleDependency> dependencies)
        Base class constructor for modules. Sets given parameters and allows ZMF to internally access their values.
        Parameters:
        uniqueId - Unique identifier of this module
        version - Version of this module, is interpreted as unsigned 16bit value
        name - Name of this module
        dependencies - Dependencies needed by this module

      • AbstractModule

        public AbstractModule(ModuleUniqueId uniqueId,
                      com.google.common.primitives.UnsignedInteger version,

                      java.util.Collection<ModuleDependency> dependencies)

        Parameters:

        version - Version of this module, is interpreted as unsigned 16bit value
        name - Name of this module
        dependencies - Dependencies needed by this module
